{{main|Criticism of Salafism}}
Salafism, or at least the so called "puritanical" forms of it, has been recently criticized by Professor [[Khaled Abou El Fadl]] of [[UCLA School of Law]]. El Fadl claims that the Salafi methodology "drifted into stifling apologetics" by mid-20th century, a reaction against "anxiety" to "render Islam compatible with modernity," by its leaders earlier in the century.<ref>Abou El Fadl, Khaled, ''The Great Theft,'' Harper San Francisco, 2005, p.77</ref>
